Authors:
Digvijayini Bundhun, Rajesh Jeewon, Indunil Chinthani
Senanayake, Erio Camporesi, Janith Vishvakeerthi Aluthmuhandiram, Alvin
M.C. Tang, Kevin D. Hyde
Title:
Discosia ravennica sp. nov and a new host record for
Sporocadus rosigena from Italy
Keywords:
1 new species; Amphisphaeriales; Molecular phylogeny;
Saprobes; Taxonomy
Abstract:
Collections of two dead leaf specimens from Italy were
subjected to morphological examination. Two coelomycetous taxa belonging
to two different genera in Xylariomycetidae, Sordariomycetes, namely
Discosia and Sporocadus, were identified. Multi-locus phylogenies based
on the nuclear ribosomal large subunit sequence (LSU), Internal
Transcribed Spacer (ITS) and Î²-tubulin (tub2) revealed that the Discosia
species is basal to D. fraxinea and D. neofraxinea and forms an
independent lineage. The latter is also different from other Discosia
species and characterized by unilocular to bilocular, superficial and
applanate conidiomata along with elongate-ampulliform conidiogenous
cells attenuated at the base and conidia smaller in size. Therefore, it
is introduced as a new species, Discosia ravennica. Our second taxon
collected is a new host record from Italy and morphological observations
coupled with multigene phylogeny also support that it is Sporocadus
rosigena. Descriptions, illustrations and molecular data for both
species are provided in this paper.
